definitions.definition: A violent flow , as of water, lava, etc.; a stream suddenly raised and running rapidly, as down a precipice .
examples: Rain fell on the hills in torrents .
A torrent of green and white water broke over the hull of the sail-boat.

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) A large amount or stream of something.
examples: They endured a torrent of inquiries.

main_definition: A violent flow , as of water, lava, etc.; a stream suddenly raised and running rapidly, as down a precipice .
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) A large amount or stream of something.

definitions.definition: A set of files obtainable through a peer-to-peer network, especially BitTorrent .
examples: I got a torrent of the complete works of Shakespeare the other day; I'm not sure why.

main_definition: ( Internet , file sharing ) A set of files obtainable through a peer-to-peer network, especially BitTorrent .
